background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Therefore, we also inspect the anomalous stream function from the simulated wind. The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. The main difference is that the simulated atmospheric response in model ensemble evolve faster than the observation. The associated diversities in the model response in the Southern Hemispheric circulations could be one of the main reasons that the simulated response exhibit great inconsistency with the observation, though the model ensembles show strong Southern Hemispheric responses especially in the mid-high latitudes.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与麦登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了一个可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了一个新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”，旨在研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也会影响斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并在涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用时进一步影响下游的纬向风。青藏高原下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是青藏高原上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应与青藏高原上的冷异常相对应，气氛下沉并在上层诱导负位势高度异常。此外，从青藏高原向北太平洋下游明显显示出波状模式的位势高度差（见图5a）。青藏高原上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧出现一个强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状的位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（见图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区，也注意到对青藏高原冷表面的位势高度响应（见图5a, b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，可以大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（teleconnections），例如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系，已经得到了广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，可以探索热带高原（TP）表面异常的详细特征以及大气环流对其的全球响应。众所周知，TP表面的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水中的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季青藏高原地表降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探索TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带低频（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动态特征相结合，重点关注其在提高季节到季节（S2S）预测中的重要性。
challengesCn: 然而，从热带地区到南半球的模拟传播路径显示出较大的模型间差异。
然而，模拟的波列与观测之间存在相位差异。然而，从北大西洋到乌拉尔山脉的区域，观测到的地势高度异常与多模型平均值呈现相反的符号，这表明在这些区域，地表冷却可能不是观测到的环流异常的主要原因。主要的区别在于，模型集合中模拟的大气响应演变速度快于观测。南半球环流中模型响应的相关多样性可能是模拟响应与观测之间存在巨大不一致的主要原因之一，尽管模型集合在南半球中高纬度地区表现出强烈的响应。

与观测相比，LS4P-I的气候模型（ESMs）都未能很好地捕捉到2003年5月的T2m冷异常。16个LS4P-I气候模型的集合均值在青藏 Plateau（TP）上表现出1.02°C的暖偏差，这一偏差强于TP T2m观测的年际变化标准差（约0.7°C）。模型集合均值的偏差空间分布如图1b所示，显示出2003年5月TP东部T2m的明显暖偏差。LS4P-I模拟进一步表明，TP表面热状态不仅对北半球具有全球影响，还影响南半球的温带大气环流，尽管由于模型间的变异性，这一影响存在较大不确定性。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中展示，同时与2003年5月的观测结果（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原(TP)的观测气温(T2m)异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局(NOAA)气候异常监测系统(CAMS, Fan和van den Dool 2008)的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心(ECMWF)大气重分析(ERA5, Hersbach等，2020)，该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的常规水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位(CRU)，在实施分析时使用版本4.02(Harris等，2014; 2020)。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的表层温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）从青藏 Plateau 调制，经过东北亚和白令海峡到达北美西部，同时影响春季的西风急流。这种由青藏 Plateau 热异常调制的TRC波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波列在影响TP表面和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，在强西风急流穿越亚太地区的情况下，TP表面降温会产生一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带性、持久性（演变时间尺度超过一个月）的TRC波列，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

Xue et al. (2022) 讨论了响应于青藏高原（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的6月降水模拟集合均值的关键特征。然而，LS4P-I实验表明，青藏高原的地表异常可以导致大气环流的持续和全球尺度异常，并对季节到季节的时间尺度上的夏季2米气温和降水产生近全球影响。此外，LS4P-I实验确认并强调了青藏高原地表异常在全球影响中的重要甚至关键作用，即热带环流（TRC）波列。对16个先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）的分析首次表明，春季青藏高原地表异常可以调节一个持续的准气压TRC波列。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏高原（TP）春季观测到的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水之间存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在不同尺度气候系统中的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探讨它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，具有从几个月到几年不等的有用技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一个社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是检查观察到的2003年5月青藏高原异常低温是否导致全球热点地区观察到的6月降水异常。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，通常集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他相关过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点和中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点区域的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表冷却的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。
challengesCn: 未能捕捉到TRC波列的参与模型在参考观测和成功模型时大大低估了气候异常。然而，从青藏 Plateau（TP）到南半球的模拟传播路径在不同模型之间存在较大差异。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。
datasetCn: 在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的观测气温（T2m）异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）从青藏高原调制一个持久的准纬向波列，经过东北亚和白令海峡到达北美西部，同时影响整个北太平洋盆地的春季西风急流。这些结果表明，青藏高原的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节内到季节间变率的主要来源。此外，青藏高原的地表温度异常还可以通过产生跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you illustrate an example of a challenge faced in data collection for modeling the impact of land temperature on global atmospheric circulation?
Example.QuestionCn: 可以举一个在数据收集过程中面临的挑战的例子，即建模地表温度对全球大气环流的影响。
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in data collection for modeling is the difficulty in robust land initialization and model configuration, as current ESMs often fail to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data, leading to discrepancies between ensemble-mean-produced T2m differences and observed anomalies.
Example.AnswerCn: 数据收集和建模中的一个挑战是土地初始化和模型配置的困难，因为当前的地球系统模型（ESMs）往往无法充分保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷，导致集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异与观测异常之间存在差异。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced by climate models when simulating subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) predictions related to land surface temperature (LST) versus those related to sea surface temperature (SST)?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 气候模型在模拟与陆面温度（LST）相关的亚季节到季节（S2S）预测时，面临的挑战与模拟与海面温度（SST）相关的预测时存在差异。
Comparison.AnswerEn: Climate models face challenges in simulating S2S predictions related to land surface temperature (LST) due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. These models often show biases in representing observed LST anomalies, especially over complex terrains like the Tibetan Plateau. In contrast, while sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies are a well-understood source of predictability, models may still struggle with capturing the full extent of SST-related teleconnections and interactions with atmospheric processes, though they generally benefit from more robust observational datasets.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 气候模型在模拟与陆地表面温度（LST）相关的季节到季节预测（S2S）时面临挑战，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据。这些模型在表示观察到的LST异常方面往往存在偏差，尤其是在像青藏高原这样复杂的地形上。相比之下，虽然海表温度（SST）异常是一个被广泛理解的可预测性来源，但模型在捕捉SST相关的远程联系和与大气过程的相互作用方面仍可能存在困难，尽管它们通常受益于更为可靠的观测数据集。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) improve the predictability of subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation patterns in high-mountain regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何初始化地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）可以提高高山地区亚季节到季节（S2S）降水模式的可预测性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The initialization of LST and SUBT is critical for enhancing the predictability of S2S precipitation patterns because it allows climate models to better simulate the observed anomalies in surface and subsurface temperatures, which in turn influence atmospheric circulation and precipitation patterns. This approach helps address biases in model simulations and improves the overall prediction skill by capturing the thermal state of high-mountain areas, such as the Tibetan Plateau, which can influence remote regions through atmospheric teleconnections.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: LST和SUBT的初始化对于增强S2S降水模式的可预测性至关重要，因为它使气候模型能够更好地模拟表面和地下温度的观测异常，这反过来又影响大气环流和降水模式。这种方法有助于解决模型模拟中的偏差，并通过捕捉高山地区（如青藏高原）的热状态来提高整体预测技能，这可以通过大气遥相关影响远程地区。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges arise in using Earth System Models (ESMs) for simulating atmospheric responses to land surface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在使用地球系统模型（ESMs）模拟高山地区陆地表面温度异常对大气反应时，会出现哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using ESMs for simulating atmospheric responses to land surface temperature anomalies include large inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways, phase differences between simulated and observed wave trains, and warm biases in temperature anomalies over regions like the Tibetan Plateau. These discrepancies suggest that model deficiencies in parameterizations and initial conditions lead to inconsistencies with observations, particularly in capturing the full effects of temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用气候模式（ESMs）模拟陆面温度异常对大气响应的挑战包括模拟传播路径的大模型间差异、模拟与观测波列之间的相位差异，以及在像青藏高原这样的地区温度异常的暖偏差。这些差异表明，模型在参数化和初始条件上的缺陷导致与观测结果的不一致，特别是在捕捉温度异常对全球大气环流的全面影响方面。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can observational datasets enhance the understanding of teleconnections between high-mountain land surface temperatures and global precipitation anomalies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 观测数据集可以通过以下方式增强对高山地表温度与全球降水异常之间遥相关性的理解：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Observational datasets, such as those from the NOAA Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and ERA5 reanalysis, provide critical data for evaluating the relationship between high-mountain land surface temperatures and global precipitation anomalies. By offering high-resolution temperature and precipitation data, these datasets help identify 'hotspot' regions where land surface temperature anomalies significantly impact precipitation patterns. They enable researchers to validate and refine model simulations, leading to improved understanding of the teleconnection mechanisms that drive S2S climate variability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观测数据集，如来自NOAA气候异常监测系统和ERA5再分析的数据，为评估高山地区地表温度与全球降水异常之间的关系提供了关键数据。通过提供高分辨率的温度和降水数据，这些数据集有助于识别地表温度异常显著影响降水模式的“热点”区域。它们使研究人员能够验证和完善模型模拟，从而提高对驱动季节到季节气候变异的遥相关机制的理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately initializing land surface temperature and snowpack for subseasonal-to-seasonal climate prediction models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响亚季节到季节气候预测模型中准确初始化地表温度和雪盖的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: There are significant challenges due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data, which provide unbalanced initial atmospheric and land conditions. Robust land initialization is critical, yet remains scientifically challenging because of a lack of observational data and a focus on local feedbacks.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷，存在显著的挑战，这导致初始大气和陆地条件不平衡。稳健的陆地初始化至关重要，但由于缺乏观测数据和对局部反馈的关注，这仍然是一个科学挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do current global land-atmosphere coupled models struggle with representing the observed lag correlation between Tibetan Plateau spring temperatures and summer precipitation in remote regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型为何难以再现观察到的青藏高原春季温度与远程地区夏季降水之间的滞后相关性？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Current models face significant errors in producing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures, which limits their ability to represent the lag correlation. This is compounded by the models' inability to fully preserve memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前模型在生成观察到的青藏 Plateau 表面温度方面面临显著错误，这限制了它们表示滞后相关性的能力。这一问题因模型参数化的缺陷而加剧，导致模型无法充分保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致从青藏高原到南半球的模拟传播路径存在较大模型间差异的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The large inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways are due to the inconsistencies in capturing the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train and its influence on atmospheric circulation, especially in the Southern Hemisphere. These differences are influenced by the variability in model responses and their ability to accurately simulate the TRC wave train's effects.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 模拟传播路径的大型模型间差异是由于在捕捉青藏高原-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列及其对大气环流影响方面的不一致性。这些差异受到模型响应的变异性及其准确模拟TRC波列效应能力的影响。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using reanalysis data like ERA5 for initial and boundary conditions in climate simulations on the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) predictions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用像ERA5这样的再分析数据作为气候模拟中的初始和边界条件，对亚季节到季节（S2S）预测的准确性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using reanalysis data like ERA5 for initial and boundary conditions can potentially improve the accuracy of S2S predictions by providing a consistent and comprehensive dataset for initializing climate models. However, deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions could limit the preservation of memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies, which is crucial for accurate S2S predictions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用像ERA5这样的再分析数据作为初始和边界条件，可能通过提供一致和全面的数据集来改善S2S预测的准确性，从而为气候模型的初始化提供支持。然而，模型参数化的缺陷和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据，可能限制了从初始化的陆面温度异常中保持记忆的能力，而这对于准确的S2S预测至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the effects of inter-model differences on the propagation pathways of wave trains from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere in climate simulations?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 不同气候模型之间的差异对来自青藏高原的波列向南半球传播路径的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Inter-model differences can result in large variability in the simulated propagation pathways of wave trains from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere. These differences can lead to inconsistencies with observations and potentially under-predict climate anomalies, affecting the reliability of models in simulating the global atmospheric response to temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 模型之间的差异可能导致从青藏高原向南半球传播波列的模拟路径出现较大变异。这些差异可能导致与观测结果的不一致，并可能低估气候异常，从而影响模型在模拟青藏高原温度异常对全球大气响应时的可靠性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the purpose of exploring the relationship between Tibetan Plateau land surface temperatures and global precipitation patterns in climate models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 探索青藏高原地表温度与全球降水模式之间关系的目的是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to determine whether high-mountain land temperatures, such as those in the Tibetan Plateau, can be a substantial source of subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation predictability, potentially providing a new source of predictability that rivals ocean surface temperature effects in global hotspot regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是确定高山地区的土地温度，例如青藏 Plateau，是否可以成为亚季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，可能提供一种新的可预测性来源，与全球热点地区的海洋表面温度效应相媲美。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the aim of using ensemble model simulations to study the atmospheric responses to Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用集合模型模拟研究青藏 Plateau 表面异常对大气响应的目的是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The aim is to understand how springtime surface anomalies in the Tibetan Plateau can modulate atmospheric circulation patterns, such as the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal wave train, which may influence early summer surface air temperatures and precipitation anomalies across various regions, thereby enhancing subseasonal-to-seasonal climate prediction capabilities.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是了解青藏 Plateau 春季表面异常如何调节大气环流模式，例如青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列，这可能影响各个地区的初夏表面气温和降水异常，从而增强亚季节到季节的气候预测能力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to initialize land surface temperature and subsurface temperature in climate models for subseasonal to seasonal prediction?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在气候模型中，为了进行亚季节到季节的预测，通常采用哪些方法来初始化地表温度和地下温度？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To initialize land surface temperature and subsurface temperature, an innovative approach is used, where LST/SUBT initial conditions are adjusted based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomaly over the Tibetan Plateau. This is done to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly and improve precipitation prediction skill.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了初始化地表温度和地下温度，采用了一种创新的方法，根据每个模型的2米气温偏差和青藏高原的观测异常来调整LST/SUBT初始条件。这是为了生成观测到的青藏高原春季冷异常，并提高降水预测技能。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific procedures are involved in using observational data to identify hotspots for enhancing precipitation prediction skill?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 使用观测数据识别增强降水预测技能的热点涉及哪些具体程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between TP T2m and global precipitation. This involves identifying locations where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill, using data from the Chinese Meteorological Administration and CAMS for temperature, and CRU data for precipitation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系。这涉及识别TP 5月地面温度的初始化可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置，使用来自中国气象局和CAMS的温度数据，以及CRU数据的降水数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are numerical experiments structured to evaluate the impact of Tibetan Plateau surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 数值实验是如何构建的，以评估青藏高原表面温度异常对全球大气环流的影响？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Two sets of numerical experiments are conducted. The first, EXP_CTRL, evaluates the performance of ESMs in simulating TP T2m and precipitation anomalies. The second, EXP_LST/SUBT, tests for biases in May surface temperature over TP by reducing the bias in TP T2m through initialized LST/SUBT conditions, while keeping other initial and boundary conditions identical to the first experiment.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 进行两组数值实验。第一组实验，EXP_CTRL，评估了地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟青藏 Plateau（TP）2米气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。第二组实验，EXP_LST/SUBT，测试了通过初始化地表温度（LST）/地下温度（SUBT）条件来减少TP T2m的偏差，从而检验5月青藏 Plateau表面温度的偏差，同时保持与第一组实验相同的其他初始和边界条件。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack in high-mountain regions for improved subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够准确初始化高山地区的地表温度和雪盖，以改善亚季节到季节的预测模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: To address the challenge of robust land initialization in prediction models, an innovative approach involves adjusting the initial conditions of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau. This method seeks to reduce model biases by initializing these conditions based on each model's temperature bias and observed anomalies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 为了解决预测模型中稳健土地初始化的挑战，一种创新的方法涉及根据每个模型的温度偏差和观测异常，调整青藏高原的地表温度和地下温度（LST/SUBT）的初始条件。这种方法旨在通过初始化这些条件来减少模型偏差。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) enable the exploration of global atmospheric circulation responses to land surface temperature anomalies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）如何使研究全球大气环流对陆地表面温度异常的响应成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: State-of-the-art ESMs are used in the LS4P project to simulate the global atmospheric circulation response to springtime land surface temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau. These models allow researchers to evaluate the performance of simulated temperature and precipitation anomalies and explore the propagation of wave trains influenced by these anomalies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）在LS4P项目中用于模拟春季青藏高原地表温度异常对全球大气环流的响应。这些模型使研究人员能够评估模拟的温度和降水异常的表现，并探讨受这些异常影响的波列传播。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological approaches enable the collection of precipitation data used for evaluating land-atmosphere interaction models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术方法能够收集降水数据，以用于评估陆气相互作用模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Precipitation data for evaluating land-atmosphere interaction models are collected using global datasets such as those from the Climate Research Unit (CRU). These datasets provide comprehensive climate data for analysis, enabling researchers to investigate precipitation patterns in relation to land surface temperature anomalies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 用于评估陆气相互作用模型的降水数据是通过全球数据集收集的，例如气候研究单位（CRU）提供的数据集。这些数据集提供了全面的气候数据供分析，使研究人员能够调查降水模式与地表温度异常之间的关系。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do current global land-atmosphere coupled models struggle to represent the lag correlation between Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures and summer precipitation in remote regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型为何难以表示青藏 Plateau 表面温度与远程地区夏季降水之间的滞后相关性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current global land-atmosphere coupled models struggle with this representation due to significant errors in producing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures. These errors hinder the models' ability to preserve memory from initialized LST anomalies, impacting their performance in simulating the observed lag correlation between spring temperatures and summer precipitation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型在这一表现上存在困难，因为它们在生成观察到的青藏高原表面温度方面存在显著误差。这些误差妨碍了模型保持初始化的地表温度异常的记忆，从而影响了它们在模拟春季温度与夏季降水之间观察到的滞后相关性方面的表现。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise from using observed T2m records to examine relationships between Tibetan Plateau temperatures and global precipitation?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用观测到的T2m记录来研究青藏高原温度与全球降水之间关系可能会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using observed T2m records to examine these relationships may include the robustness of land initialization and model configuration, which remain scientifically challenging. Additionally, there is a need to address model deficiencies in producing the full TP T2m anomaly and correct precipitation anomalies, which might impact the accuracy of predictions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 使用观测的T2m记录来研究这些关系的挑战可能包括土地初始化和模型配置的稳健性，这仍然是科学上具有挑战性的。此外，还需要解决模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和正确的降水异常方面的不足，这可能会影响预测的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods ensure the accuracy of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature measurements over high mountain areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何确保高山地区地表温度和地下温度测量的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The accuracy of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature measurements over high mountain areas is ensured through robust land initialization and model configuration. Observed T2m records, such as those from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS), are used to examine possible relationships between TP T2m and global precipitation.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 高山地区的地表温度和地下温度测量的准确性通过稳健的土地初始化和模型配置得以保证。通过使用中国气象局（CMA）和气候异常监测系统（CAMS）等观测的2米温度记录，来研究青藏 Plateau（TP）2米温度与全球降水之间的可能关系。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in using Earth System Models for predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal climate anomalies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对使用地球系统模型预测亚季节到季节气候异常所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: One of the challenges in using Earth System Models (ESMs) for predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal climate anomalies is the large inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere. Additionally, ESMs often have biases in land surface temperature simulations, which can affect predictions of climate anomalies.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 使用地球系统模型（ESMs）预测亚季节到季节气候异常的一个挑战是，从青藏高原向南半球传播路径的模拟存在较大的模型间差异。此外，ESMs在地表温度模拟方面通常存在偏差，这可能影响气候异常的预测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate the challenges and limitations faced by current Earth System Models in simulating the influence of land surface temperature anomalies on subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查当前地球系统模型在模拟陆面温度异常对亚季节到季节降水预测影响时面临的挑战和限制。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Current Earth System Models face challenges such as large inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways, bias in surface temperature predictions, and inability to fully capture observed anomalies. These limitations are due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions that hinder accurate simulation of land–atmosphere interactions and precipitation predictions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 当前的地球系统模型面临着一些挑战，例如模拟传播路径的模型间差异较大、地表温度预测的偏差以及无法完全捕捉到观察到的异常。这些局限性源于模型参数化的不足和初始大气/陆地条件的不平衡，这妨碍了对陆气相互作用和降水预测的准确模拟。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets and reanalysis tools that could be utilized to improve the modeling of land surface temperature impacts on global atmospheric circulations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别潜在的数据集和再分析工具，以改善陆面温度对全球大气环流影响的建模。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets and reanalysis tools that could be utilized include the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) for temperature anomalies and the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) for atmospheric conditions. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data provides global precipitation information which can be used to improve the modeling of land surface temperature impacts on atmospheric circulations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集和重分析工具包括国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS）用于温度异常，以及第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5）用于大气条件。气候研究单位（CRU）数据提供全球降水信息，可用于改善陆面温度对大气环流影响的建模。
